greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of cosh(1).
comment: Also decimal expansion of cos(i). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 12 2010
Equals sum_{n>=0} 1/A010050(n). See Gradsteyn-Ryzhik (0.245.5). - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 27 2012
By the Lindemann-Weierstrass theorem, this constant is transcendental. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 14 2019
reference: S. Selby, editor, CRC Basic Mathematical Tables, CRC Press, 1970, p. 218.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hyperbolic Cosine
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Hyperbolic Functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Factorial Sums
formula: Continued fraction representation: cosh(1) = 1 + 1/(2 - 2/(13 - 12/(31 - ... - (2*n - 4)*(2*n - 5)/((4*n^2 - 10*n + 7) - ... )))). See A051396 for proof. Cf. A049470 (cos(1)) and A073742 (sinh(1)). - _Peter Bala_, Sep 05 2016
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Aug 07 2002
